comments.body: I'm not convinced that novice/beginner users should know about `scala.compiletime`. Everything in that package is for more advanced users that understand the language already.
Why need an import for this language feature at all?

Because it's a very special case. Normally, fields should be initialized. In the special cases where that's no the case and import is in order. That's not for novices, so knowing about compiletime is OK.
